name: From Metagenomic Sample to Useful Visual
short_description:
UPDATES/ NOTICES WILL BE POSTED TO THE DISCUSSION TAB: http://sourceforge.net/p/metagenomicvis/discussion/general/


Subgoals:
*Pick out anomalies within a given dataset. 
*Generate time series representation of multiple datasets.
*Compress data efficiently to allow visualization of huge datasets. 

Click on the "Files" tab for links to additional resources.


Data:

Human Metagenome:  
ftp.ll.mit.edu/outgoing/BCD2/abscess.tar.gz
ftp.ll.mit.edu/outgoing/BCD2/nicaragua.tar.gz
ftp.ll.mit.edu/outgoing/BCD2/oral_diseased.tar.gz
ftp.ll.mit.edu/outgoing/BCD2/oral_healthy.tar.gz
ftp.ll.mit.edu/outgoing/BCD2/palm.tar.gz 

Non-Human Metagenome: 
ftp.ll.mit.edu/outgoing/environmental1.tar.gz
ftp.ll.mit.edu/outgoing/environmental2.tar.gz
ftp.ll.mit.edu/outgoing/environmental3.tar.gz
ftp.ll.mit.edu/outgoing/BCD2/soil.tar.gz
summary: Invent novel visualization approaches to represent metagenomic data.
